intro: Hiptage stellulifera var. stellulifera, commonly known as the star-leaved hiptage, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. The leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are typically arranged in terminal panicles.
